bill.title: Mississippi Medicaid law; make technical amendments to.
bill.description: An Act Relating To The Administration Of The Mississippi Medicaid Law; To Amend Section 43-13-117, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Authorize The Division To Implement An Ambulatory Payment Classification (apc) Reimbursement Methodology For Outpatient Hospital Costs; To Allow The Division To Reimburse For More Than Two Innovator Multiple Source Drugs When Less Expensive Than The Generic Equivalent; To Authorize The Division To Implement A State Maximum Allowable Cost (smac) Program For Reimbursement Of Prescription Drugs; To Remove The Requirements Concerning The Reimbursement Of Crossover Claims; To Authorize The Division To Place Cost Ceilings And Limits On Reimbursement For Nursing Facility Services For The Severely Disabled; To Lock-in Provider Rates At June 30, 2010, Levels; To Remove The Fifteen Percent Limit On Participation In A Medicaid Managed Care Program; To Authorize The Division To Implement An Apr-drg Reimbursement Methodology For Inpatient Hospital Services; To Remove The Requirement That Payments Made By A Managed Care Organization Count For Dsh And Upl Purposes; To Authorize The Division To Collect Overpayments To Providers Prior To The Conclusion Of An Appeal; To Amend Section 43-13-317, Mississippi Code Of 1972, To Clarify That The Homestead Exemption Shall Not Apply To Diminish The Division's Claim In An Estate Recovery Proceeding; And For Related Purposes.

step.action: Referred To Public Health and Welfare
